oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Arm brassard
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This arm brassard was used by veterans of the 30th Div. in the years after WWI. The 30th Div. was composed of National Guard units from Tennessee and the Carolinas. All three states claimed Andrew Jackson and thus the division carried the nickname, "Old Hickory." Old Hickory Post No. 1 was located in Chattanooga and included many former members of the 114th Field Artillery, 30th Div.
